overview:
Jon Seeber is a Principal at Updata Partners in the Edison, New Jersey office and joined the firm in 2006. He supports the firm’s deal sourcing and due diligence efforts, and works closely with Updata Partners portfolio companies.

Prior to joining the Updata Partners team, Mr. Seeber worked for IBM Global Services Business Development, where he managed acquisition, divestiture, and investment activities for IBM’s largest business unit. He played a key role on several deals, including the acquisitions of Internet Security Systems, Healthlink, and Corio, leading efforts ranging from strategy development and due diligence to negotiation and integration planning.

From 1998 to 2002, Mr. Seeber served on active duty in the US Air Force as an Intelligence Officer, first leading combat intelligence collection missions for Operation SOUTHERN WATCH, and later managing the development of information systems for the Air Force and the Intelligence Community. He holds a U.S. patent for optimizing remote method invocation in the JAVA programming language (U.S. Patent No. 6,125,400), and another (U.S. Patent No. 7,406,606) for reducing false positives in network intrusion detection.
